result.execSummary:
The defendant Donte N Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Fine is set at ZERO.
*Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 01/30/2017. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
*Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence; release for inmate work assignments within the House of Correction and the Day Reporting Center; with credit for 28 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  Drivers license suspension is not imposed. Court DENIES defense request for expungement. The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).
*Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

ADDRESS INFO for Donte N Thomas
Current: 811 W VLIET ST APT 598, Milwaukee, WI 53205   (Effective: 01-28-2015)
Prior: 1430 North 21st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205

Defendant Donte N Thomas in court with attorney Torrie Renee Williams.  Defendant Donte N Thomas in custody. Paul Hauer on behalf of Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 10 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; release for inmate work assignments within the House of Correction and the Day Reporting Center; with credit for 28 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 01/30/2017. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Court DENIES defense request for expungement. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Court notified that defendant is now in custody. Case set for bail/bond hearing on 12/15/2016, at 08:30 am, Branch 17. PD office notified of need for appointment of counsel. LNR

Case in court due to violation: Drug Test- Positive.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant. Court amends cash bail.  Case remains calendared for sentencing on 08-14-2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 17.

Case recalled. Same appearances.
Case proceeded to plea hearing.
AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.   Parties notified that effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310. Court vacted jury trial on 08-24-2015. :  Court REITERATES that the defendant is to comply with conditons of bail. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
 
Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 08-14-2015 at 8:30 am to Branch 17.
